question: Wular Lake, one of the biggest freshwater lakes in Asia, is located in which state/UT?
solution:
• Wular Lake is located in Jammu & Kashmir.
  • Formed due to tectonic activity, fed by the Jhelum river.
  • Among largest freshwater lakes in Asia.
  • Other important lakes in J&K: Dal Lake, Pangong Lake, Mansar Lake.
  • Extra Static GK:
    • Capital: Srinagar (summer), Jammu (winter)
    • Dance: Rouf, Dumhal, Bhand Pather
    • Festival: Hemis (famous Buddhist Festival in Ladakh),
    • Rivers: Jhelum, Chenab, Ravi
    • Jammu & Kashmir is known for Saffron cultivation (Pampore).
    • Dam: Baglihar Dam (Chenab), Salal Dam (Chenab), Uri Dam (Jhelum)
    • Article 370 was removed on 5 August 2019 making it a Union Territory
    • Chenab Rail Bridge is the world’s highest railway bridge inaugurated in 2024

question: Which is the largest saline water lake in India?
solution:
• Chilika Lake is located in Odisha.
  • Largest saline water lagoon in India, also Asia’s largest brackish water lagoon.
  • Famous for irrawaddy dolphins and migratory birds.
  • Other important lakes in Odisha: Ansupa Lake, Kanjia Lake.
  • Extra Static GK:
    • Capital: Bhubaneswar
    • Dances: Odissi, Gotipua, Chhau
    • Festivals: Rath Yatra (Puri), Nuakhai, Raja Parba
    • Mountains/Peaks: Deomali (highest peak of Odisha), Mahendragiri, Malayagiri
    • Dams: Hirakud Dam (Mahanadi), Rengali Dam (Brahmani), Mandira Dam (Sankh)
    • Kalinga War was fought at Dhauli near Bhubaneswar in 261 BC.

question: Which is the longest lake in India?
solution:
• Vembanad Lake is located in Kerala.
  • Longest lake in India, covering 96 km length.
  • Famous for Nehru Trophy Boat Race (held in Punnamada part).
  • Other important lakes in Kerala: Ashtamudi Lake, Sasthamkotta Lake.
  • Extra Static GK:
    • Capital: Thiruvananthapuram
    • Rivers: Periyar, Bharathapuzha, Pamba
    • Dances: Kathakali, Mohiniyattam, Theyyam
    • Festivals: Onam, Vishu, Thrissur Pooram
    • Mountains/Peaks: Anamudi (highest peak of South India), Agasthyamalai, Chembra Peak
    • Dams: Idukki Dam (Periyar), Mullaperiyar Dam (Periyar), Malampuzha Dam (Bharathapuzha)
    • Kerala is called “God’s Own Country” and first state to achieve 100% literacy in 1991
    • SilverLine semi-high-speed rail project

question: Which is the highest lake in India?
solution:
• Cholamu Lake is located in Sikkim, near the Indo-China border.
  • Highest lake in India at an altitude of 5,330 m (17,487 ft).
  • Restricted area, special permits required for visit.
  • Other important lakes in Sikkim: Gurudongmar Lake, Tsomgo Lake.
  • Extra Static GK:
    • Capital: Gangtok
    • Rivers: Teesta, Rangit, Lachen Chu
    • Dances: Maruni, Singhi Chaam, Tamang Selo
    • Festivals: Losoong, Saga Dawa, Pang Lhabsol
    • Mountains/Peaks: Kanchenjunga (India’s highest peak), Pandim, Kabru
    • Dams: Rangit Dam (Rangit river), Teesta Stage III Dam (Teesta river)
    • Sikkim is India’s first organic state and became the 22nd state in 1975
    • Kanchenjunga National Park is UNESCO World Heritage Site.
  • Note: While Gurudongmar Lake is often cited as one of the highest, Tso Lhamo (also called as Cholamu lake) edges it out in elevation and is considered the highest by most sources.

question: Lonar Lake is located in which state?
solution:
• Lonar Lake is located in Buldhana district, Maharashtra.
  • Formed by meteor impact, saline soda lake, notified as National Geo-heritage Monument.
  • Famous for unique basaltic rock ecosystem.
  • Other important lakes in Maharashtra: Shivsagar Lake, Rankala Lake.
  • Extra Static GK:
    • Capital: Mumbai
    • Rivers: Godavari, Krishna, Bhima
    • Dances: Lavani, Tamasha, Koli
    • Festivals: Ganesh Chaturthi, Gudi Padwa, Ellora Festival
    • Mountains/Peaks: Kalsubai (highest peak in Maharashtra), Harishchandragad, Salher
    • Dams: Jayakwadi Dam (Godavari), Koyna Dam (Koyna), Ujjani Dam (Bhima)
    • Mumbai is India’s financial capital and headquarters of RBI, SEBI, BSE
    • Ajanta and Ellora caves are UNESCO World Heritage Sites in Maharashtra.

question: Pulicat Lake is located in which Indian state?
solution:
Pulicat Lake is primarily located in Andhra Pradesh, within Nellore district, though a portion also lies in Tamil Nadu (Tiruvallur district).
  • It is India’s second-largest brackish water lagoon, after Chilika.
  • The lake is separated from the Bay of Bengal by Sriharikota Island, which houses the Satish Dhawan Space Centre.
  • It's famous for Greater flamingos, especially during winter migration.
  • Despite its ecological importance, Pulicat Lake is not yet recognized as a Ramsar site.

question: Kolleru Lake is located in which Indian state?
solution:
Kolleru Lake lies in Andhra Pradesh, nestled between the Krishna and Godavari river deltas.
  • It’s a seasonal freshwater lake, expanding during monsoon.
  • The lake was declared a Ramsar site in 2002, due to its rich biodiversity.
  • It hosts birds like the Spot-billed pelican, painted stork, and egrets.
  • Major threats include aquaculture encroachments and shrinking wetland area.
  • Located in West Godavari and Krishna districts, it’s a crucial flood-balancing system.

question: Haflong Lake is located in which Indian state?
solution:
• Haflong Lake is located in Assam, specifically in Dima Hasao district.
  • It’s situated in the scenic hill town of Haflong, the only hill station in Assam.
  • The lake is popular for boating, birdwatching, and serene views.
  • Development was carried out under the AMRUT urban scheme.
  • Surrounding community primarily belongs to the Dimasa tribe, known for their rich heritage.
  • However, waste disposal and encroachments threaten its water quality.

question: Deepor Beel is located in which Indian state?
solution:
• Deepor Beel is located in Assam, near Guwahati city, and is a permanent freshwater wetland.
  • It was declared a Ramsar site in 2002, due to its rich biodiversity.
  • It supports endangered species like the Asian elephant and various waterfowl.
  • The wetland is part of an elephant migration corridor, needing protection from urban pressure.
  • It faces threats from solid waste dumping from nearby city areas.
  • Important for flood control, groundwater recharge, and winter bird migration.

question: Chandubi Lake is located in which Indian state?
solution:
• Chandubi Lake lies in Kamrup district of Assam, near the foothills of the Garo Hills.
  • Formed during the 1897 earthquake, it resulted from ground subsidence.
  • Surrounded by forests, the lake offers boating and is rich in natural flora and fauna.
  • It is a popular spot for fishing and eco-tourism, especially among locals.
  • Cultural ties with Rabha and Garo communities add depth to its heritage.
  • Though beautiful, it lacks formal conservation status like Ramsar designation.

question: Kanwar Lake is located in which Indian state?
solution:
• Kanwar Lake is situated in Begusarai district, Bihar.
  • It is the largest freshwater oxbow lake in Asia.
  • Designated as a Ramsar site in 2020, promoting wetland conservation.
  • Bihar celebrates unique festivals like Chhath Puja and Sama-Chakeva, linked to water bodies.
  • Popular folk dances include Jat-Jatin, Bidesia, and Jhijhiya.
  • Ongoing efforts in Bihar focus on eco-tourism and biodiversity protection.
  • Wetland degradation due to encroachment and pollution is a major concern.

question: Hamirsar Lake is located in which Indian state?
solution:
• Hamirsar Lake is in the city of Bhuj, Gujarat.
  • Built in the 16th century by Rao Hamir, a Jadeja ruler.
  • Locals celebrate a tradition where the Mayor walks barefoot to the temple when the lake fills.
  • Gujarat is known for festivals like Navratri, featuring Garba and Dandiya Raas.
  • The state leads in renewable energy, textile industry, and heritage tourism.
  • Bhuj is part of the Kutch region, famous for Rann Utsav and handicrafts.
  • Post-2001 earthquake, Bhuj saw major heritage restoration initiatives.

question: Kankaria Lake is located in which Indian state?
solution:
• Kankaria Lake is located in Ahmedabad, Gujarat.
  • Originally built in the 15th century by Sultan Qutb-ud-Din, it’s now a recreation hub.
  • The lake has attractions like Kankaria Zoo, Toy Train, and Balloon Ride.
  • Hosts the annual Kankaria Carnival, promoting art, music, and cultural heritage.
  • Gujarat is home to the Gir National Park, the last abode of Asiatic lions.
  • Ahmedabad is India’s first UNESCO World Heritage City.
  • The state is known for entrepreneurship, and urban smart city projects.

question: Badkhal Lake is located in which Indian state?
solution:
• Badkhal Lake is situated near Faridabad, Haryana.
  • Once a natural lake, it’s now part of a revival project for eco-tourism.
  • Known for hosting the Badkhal Festival, with crafts, culture, and food.
  • Haryana is rich in cultural dance forms like Phag, Dhamal, and Ghoomar.
  • The state ranks high in sports excellence, especially wrestling and boxing.
  • Important current affairs include the development of Amrit Sarovar schemes for water conservation.
  • Nearby attractions include Surajkund Mela, an international craft fair.

question: Brahma Sarovar is located in which Indian state?
solution:
• Brahma Sarovar is located in Kurukshetra, Haryana.
  • Believed to be the site where Lord Brahma began creation, mentioned in ancient texts.
  • Important for rituals during solar eclipses; lakhs gather to take a holy dip.
  • Hosts Gita Jayanti Mahotsav, celebrating the birth of the Bhagavad Gita.
  • Haryana’s heritage includes Mahabharata links, traditional crafts, and spiritual tourism.
  • Dance forms like Dhamal and Gugga Naach reflect its folk culture.
  • Kurukshetra is emerging as an educational and spiritual hub, with government-backed development.

question: Chandra Taal is located in which Indian state?
solution:
• Chandra Taal (meaning Lake of the Moon) lies in Lahaul-Spiti district, Himachal Pradesh.
  • It is a high-altitude glacial lake located at 4,300 meters in the Himalayas.
  • Known for its crescent shape and changing water hues due to sunlight.
  • Historically, it was a resting spot for traders on the Silk Route crossing Kunzum Pass.
  • Himachal Pradesh is famous for Kullu Dussehra, Nati folk dance, and Shivratri festivals.
  • Chandra Taal is part of a cold desert biosphere and attracts trekkers and photographers.
  • Protected under Wetland Conservation Rules due to its fragile ecosystem.

question: Maharana Pratap Sagar is located in which Indian state?
solution:
• Maharana Pratap Sagar (also known as Pong Dam Lake) is in Kangra district, Himachal Pradesh.
  • Created in 1975 after the construction of Pong Dam on Beas River, primarily for irrigation.
  • Named in honor of Maharana Pratap, the Rajput warrior who fought valiantly in the Battle of Haldighati (1576).
  • The lake was declared a Ramsar site in 2002, sheltering migratory birds like bar-headed geese.
  • Himachal hosts Minjar fair, Lohri, and has rich traditions of Kinnauri and Chamba folk arts.
  • It’s also a hub for birdwatching, boating, and water sports, boosting eco-tourism.

question: Dal Lake is located in which Indian state or UT?
solution:
• Dal Lake lies in Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir, often dubbed the “Jewel of the Kashmir Valley.”
  • Famous for Shikara rides, houseboats, and floating markets.
  • Linked historically to Mughals, especially Emperor Jahangir, who cherished its scenic beauty.
  • Surrounded by Mughal gardens like Shalimar Bagh and Nishat Bagh, showcasing Persian architecture.
  • Kashmir’s festivals include Eid, Holi, and Tulip Festival, reflecting cultural diversity.
  • Dal Lake is facing challenges due to urban encroachment, but efforts like lake cleaning missions are active.
  • Integral to tourism and cultural identity of J&K.

question: Sambhar Lake is located in which Indian state?
solution:
• Sambhar Lake is India's largest inland saltwater lake, situated in Rajasthan’s Jaipur and Nagaur districts.
  • It is famous for salt production, contributing significantly to national output.
  • Home to migratory birds like flamingos and declared a Ramsar site.
  • Rajasthan hosts vibrant festivals like Pushkar Fair, Desert Festival, and Teej.
  • Folk traditions include Kalbelia dance, Ghoomar, and Kathputli puppetry.
  • Sambhar was a part of the ancient Mahabharata kingdom, mentioned as a battlefield between Balarama and King Rukmi.
  • Environmental concerns include shrinking water levels and unregulated salt mining.

question: Tsomgo Lake is located in which Indian state?
solution:
• Tsomgo Lake, also spelled Changu Lake, is a glacial lake in East Sikkim, near Nathula Pass.
  • Located at an altitude of 3,753 meters, it’s fed by melting snow.
  • Recognized for changing water colors and rare high-altitude flora.
  • Associated with Sikkimese shamanic rituals performed by the Lepcha tribe.
  • Sikkim celebrates Losar, Saga Dawa, and Bumchu festivals, reflecting Tibetan Buddhist traditions.
  • Folk dances include Chu Faat and Yak dance.
  • Sikkim is India’s first organic farming state, and a biodiversity hotspot in the Eastern Himalayas.

question: Hussain Sagar is located in which Indian state?
solution:
• Hussain Sagar Lake connects Hyderabad and Secunderabad in Telangana.
  • Built in 1562 by Hussain Shah Wali, it’s named after him.
  • Known for the Gigantic Buddha Statue, installed on Rock of Gibraltar island.
  • Telangana celebrates Bathukamma, Bonalu, and Sammakka Saralamma festivals.
  • Popular dance forms include Perini Shiva Tandavam and Lambadi folk dance.
  • Lake faces pollution issues, leading to multiple revival schemes under HMDA and NEERI.
  • Telangana is known for its tech parks, charminar heritage, and Handloom sector development.

question: Govind Ballabh Pant Sagar is located in which Indian state?
solution:
• Govind Ballabh Pant Sagar is a reservoir in Sonbhadra district, Uttar Pradesh.
  • Formed by the Rihand Dam on the Rihand River, a tributary of the Son River.
  • It is India’s largest man-made reservoir by area.
  • Named after Govind Ballabh Pant, India’s freedom fighter and ex-CM of UP.
  • Uttar Pradesh celebrates Kumbh Mela, Krishna Janmashtami, and Ram Lila with grandeur.
  • Famous for Kathak dance, Awadhi cuisine, and literary traditions.
  • Sonbhadra is called “Energy Capital of India” due to its coal-fired power plants and industries.

question: Bhimtal Lake is located in which Indian state?
solution:
• Bhimtal Lake lies in Nainital district, Uttarakhand, named after Bhim from the Mahabharata.
  • It’s larger than Naini Lake and has a small island with an aquarium.
  • Part of the Kumaon hills, rich in biodiversity and scenic landscapes.
  • Uttarakhand celebrates Ghee Sankranti, Harela, and Nanda Devi Raj Jat Yatra.
  • Folk dances include Jhora, Chholiya, and Langvir Nritya.
  • Bhimtal has historical ties to ancient trade routes to Nepal and Tibet.
  • It’s emerging as a tourism and birdwatching hotspot, with increasing eco-tourism initiatives.

question: Bhojtal is located in which Indian state?
solution:
• Bhojtal, also known as Upper Lake, lies in Bhopal, Madhya Pradesh.
  • Built by Raja Bhoj (11th century), a famous Parmar dynasty king.
  • It supplies drinking water to major parts of Bhopal city.
  • MP celebrates Khajuraho Dance Festival, Malwa Utsav, and Tansen Samaroh.
  • Traditional arts include Gondi painting, Baiga tribal rituals, and Mandana art.
  • Bhojtal supports aquatic life and has a Van Vihar National Park adjacent to its banks.
  • It's part of city’s smart urban water management and lake conservation strategy.

question: Shivsagar Lake is located in which Indian state?
solution:
• Shivsagar Lake is formed by the Koyna Dam on the Koyna River, in Satara district, Maharashtra.
  • It’s a hydroelectric reservoir, powering the Koyna Hydroelectric Project, crucial for energy supply.
  • Named in honor of Shivaji Maharaj, symbolizing valor and Marathi pride.
  • Maharashtra is home to festivals like Ganesh Chaturthi, Ellora Festival, and Gudi Padwa.
  • Classical forms include Lavani dance, Tamasha, and Powada ballads.
  • The region lies in the Western Ghats, part of UNESCO World Heritage biodiversity zones.
  • Koyna is also a seismically active zone, used for geological research.

question: Loktak Lake is located in which Indian state?
solution:
• Loktak Lake is in Bishnupur district, Manipur, and is India’s largest freshwater lake in the northeast.
  • Famous for Phumdis (floating biomass islands) and Keibul Lamjao National Park, home to Sangai deer.
  • Manipur hosts vibrant festivals like Yaoshang, Lai Haraoba, and Ratha Yatra Imphal.
  • Classical dance form Manipuri Ras Leela and martial art Thang Ta are notable.
  • Loktak is a Ramsar site, crucial for ecology and local fishery livelihoods.
  • Current eco-projects focus on phumdi removal, wetland clean-up, and community engagement for conservation.

question: Which lake is famous for floating islands called ‘Phumdis’?
solution:
• Loktak Lake is located in Manipur, in Bishnupur district.
  • It is known for Phumdis, which are floating islands made of organic biomass and vegetation.
  • The lake houses Keibul Lamjao National Park, the world’s only floating national park and habitat of Sangai deer, Manipur’s state animal.
  • Loktak is a designated Ramsar site, critical for biodiversity and wetland conservation.
  • Supports over 55 surrounding villages through fishing, agriculture, and water use.
  • Manipur is culturally rich with festivals like Yaoshang, Lai Haraoba, and dance forms such as Manipuri Ras Leela.
  • Current conservation efforts include phumdi removal and wetland restoration under national and community programs.

question:
What is the deepest lake in India?

Options
solution:
• Manasbal Lake is the deepest lake in India, located in Ganderbal district, Jammu and Kashmir.
  • Its maximum depth is approximately 43 meters, making it deeper than Dal and Wular.
  • It is a freshwater lake, fed by underground springs and precipitation, with no major inlet.
  • Known for lotus blooms, especially on its northern banks, enhancing its ecological charm.
  • Nearby lies the Jaroka Bagh, a Mughal garden built by Nur Jahan, adding historic value.
  • Recently, it gained attention as the site for NCC naval training revival by the Indian Navy.

question: Which lake is known as the “Queen of Lakes” in Kerala?
solution:
• Sasthamkotta Lake, marked in option (d) with full nomenclature, is the correct answer.
  • Located in Kollam district, Kerala, it is the largest freshwater lake in the state.
  • Revered as the “Queen of Lakes”, it’s named after the nearby ancient Sastha temple.
  • Declared a Ramsar site in 2002, highlighting its global ecological importance.
  • Supplies drinking water to over 500,000 residents, showcasing its utility.
  • Kerala is renowned for festivals like Onam, Thrissur Pooram, and Vishu.
  • Classical art forms include Kathakali, Mohiniyattam, and Koodiyattam.
  • Sasthamkotta is home to wetland birds like herons, egrets, and kingfishers, attracting birdwatchers.
  • The lake is under restoration through the National Lake Conservation Plan and state eco-projects.

question: Which lake is known as the “Mystery Lake”?
solution:
• Roopkund Lake, located in Chamoli district, Uttarakhand, is famously known as the “Mystery Lake” or “Skeleton Lake”.
  • Situated at an altitude of 5,029 meters, it is a high-altitude glacial lake surrounded by snow-clad peaks like Trishul and Nanda Ghunti.
  • The lake gained global attention due to the discovery of hundreds of human skeletons around its edges, visible when the snow melts.
  • Scientific studies revealed that the remains belong to multiple groups, including South Asians and Mediterranean individuals, who died in separate events over 1,000 years.
  • Local legends link the deaths to a hailstorm during a pilgrimage, possibly caused by the wrath of Goddess Nanda Devi.
  • Roopkund is part of the Nanda Devi Raj Jat Yatra, a sacred trek held every 12 years, celebrating regional mythology.
  • The lake is a popular trekking destination, though tourism is now regulated to protect its fragile ecosystem and historic remains.
